poem:
**A Diplomatic Breakfast**

This morning, headlines roll out  
like mismatched socks from the dryer.  
Starmer and Macron, bent over maps,  
stir their coffee, plot peace like a chess game.  
Meanwhile, the world balances  
on the edge of a newspaper page,  
hoping the leaders' pens  
write softer lines  
of ink along the fragile borders of hope.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK and France will work on own Ukraine peace plan, says Keir Starmer Britain and France will work on their own peace plan for Ukraine, Keir Starmer has said, as European leaders scrambled to respond to Friday’s disastrous White House meeting between Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy. The prime minister told the BBC on Sunday that he and the French president, Emmanuel Macron, had agreed to begin negotiations separate to those between the US and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
